intro: Streptanthera cuprea var. non-picta, commonly known as the coppery streptanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while the stems are slender and often branched. This variety is distinguished from other Streptanthera species by its unique coloration and habitat preferences.
